title: NBA Playoffs: Warriors eliminate Kings and Heat take Game 1 from Knicks
description: Stephen Curry was nearly unstoppable as the Warriors defeated the Sacramento Kings 120-100, on Sunday. Meanwhile, Jimmy Butler scored 25 points and grabbed 11 rebounds to lead Miami over New York 108-101 but suffered a right ankle injury.

title: Suspected Islamic State group chief killed in Syria, Turkey says
description: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan said Sunday that Abu Hussein al-Qurashi had been killed in an operation carried out by Turkey's MIT intelligence agency. Turkey has deployed troops in northern Syria since 2020.

title: Five unique museums to visit with kids in and around Paris
description: Embark on an adventure to discover the history of trains, descend into the Parisian sewer system, or attend a concert performed by moles all while enjoying the company of your beloved pet. These unconventional activities promise a one-of-a-kind family getaway.

title: UN sending envoy over 'unprecedented' Sudan war fallout
description: Stephane Dujarric, the spokesman for Secretary-General Antonio Guterres, said Sunday the UN chief was 'immediately' sending Martin Griffiths, his emergency relief coordinator, to the area 'in light of the rapidly deteriorating humanitarian crisis in Sudan.' More than 500 people have been killed.

title: All eyes on US VP Kamala Harris after Biden 2024 reelection bid
description: Questions over 80-year-old Joe Biden's ability to carry out a second term are putting the US vice president in the spotlight.

title: #PrettyPrivilege: Does beauty really benefit you in life?
description: Attractive features facilitate professional or social success, but they also convey stereotypes such as superficiality or stupidity. Doesn't true beauty come from the heart?

title: French police show feelings of 'discontent' after weeks of protests
description: As protesters disrupt the travel of government members, police forces are experiencing an unprecedented level of solicitation since the Yellow Vests movement.

title: Fend off the sea or let it flood the land? A dilemma along France's Atlantic coast
description: The dike that protects the Brouage marsh in the Charente-Maritime region has become increasingly weakened. Repairing it would offer many environmental and economic advantages, but would doom grain farms.

title: La Rochelle to play Leinster in Champions Cup final
description: Holders La Rochelle will play four-time winners Leinster in the Champions Cup final after despatching Exeter 47-28 in the semi-final in Bordeaux on Sunday, April 30.

title: Catch me if you can: The fake spy, real-life crook who conned his way across France
description: A 59-year-old Frenchman scoured the country posing as a British secret agent, heir to a line of Scottish lords and friend of the most powerful and important people. His victims are numerous and court decisions have been completely ineffective.

title: Napoli miss chance to win Serie A with Salernitana draw
description: Napoli missed the chance to win Serie A for the first time in 33 years on Sunday after being held to a 1-1 draw by Salernitana.

title: First Red Cross aid flight lands in Sudan as fighting rages
description: About 75,000 have been displaced by the fighting, according to the United Nations.

title: Pope Francis denounces 'the doors closed to those who are foreign, migrants, poor' on trip to Hungary
description: On the third and last day of his visit to Hungary, in front of Prime Minister Viktor Orban, the head of the Catholic Church wished on Sunday for a wider reception of those who are foreigners and migrants.

title: China and Taiwan: Is a conflict inevitable?
description: China's military exercises in the Taiwan Strait after the Taiwanese president's visit to the United States in early April are a reminder of how fragile the island's status quo is.

title: Japan authorizes access to the abortion pill, but with heavy restrictions
description: Medication abortions must be performed in a health facility, and, like surgical abortions, they will not be covered by national health insurance. Spousal consent also remains mandatory.

title: Champions Cup: Against La Rochelle, Exeter carries the last hopes of an English rugby in crisis
description: The last English representatives in the European Cup, the Chiefs face the Maritimes on Sunday for a place in the final. It's an opportunity to save the honor of English rugby after a nightmarish season, plagued by economic difficulties.

title: Toulouse wins French Cup: Football reigns supreme in land of rugby for first time in 66 years
description: Winners of the French Cup for the first time in 66 years against Nantes (5-1), the players of the Toulouse FC have momentarily eclipsed the rugby players of the Stade Toulousain, eliminated in the semi-finals of the Champions Cup.

title: Uzbekistan votes on reforms to extend president's term
description: One of the main reforms is expected to be extending presidential terms from five to seven years, and allow the 65-year-old current President Shavkat Mirziyoyev to serve two more terms.

title: Martin Scorsese and Timothée Chalamet took the subway. Does anyone care?
description: What were the director of 'Taxi Driver' and the 'Call Me by Your Name' actor doing in a New York subway car on April 22?

title: In Ghana, female skateboarders are living their passion despite prejudice
description: In the heart of Accra, a skatepark is the first of its kind in West Africa. Every Thursday, the day is reserved for young women.

title: War in Ukraine: Russia finds loopholes in Western sanctions
description: A system of circumvention set up by third countries means Russia has been able to receive the equipment it needs despite the European Union's sanctions, in place since February 2022.

title: What's the carbon footprint of a computer?
description: Laptops often have a lower impact than desktop machines. Gamer-oriented models, on the other hand, are reaching new heights.

title: African genome research is trying to take off on the continent
description: Less than 2% of the recorded genomes come from African individuals even though much of the human genetic diversity has remained on the continent.

title: Death in the workplace: Unions demand accountability from French government
description: In France, about 1,000 people died while at work in 2021. A collective of victims' families and several trade unions met on Friday in front of the French Labor Ministry to demand strong measures.
